titleStmt.title: Eschatos echthros, or, The death of death in the death of Christ being a narrative of the first death as the mistress of mortals and empress of the universe : conflicting of various sections and directions (as appears by the index) in order to a holy living and happy dying / by R. Mayhew ...
titleStmt.author: Mayhew, R. (Richard)

titleStmt.title: Eschatos echthros, or, The death of death in the death of Christ being a narrative of the first death as the mistress of mortals and empress of the universe : conflicting of various sections and directions (as appears by the index) in order to a holy living and happy dying / by R. Mayhew ...
titleStmt.author: Mayhew, R. (Richard)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Showden for the author ...,

notesStmt.note: First two words of title in Greek characters.
"Poema Mortuale, or, An elegy upon death, the law of nature and tribute of mortals / by R.M., no poet or the son of a poet ..., 1679" has separate t.p. on p. [16] at end.
Running title reads: The death of Christ, the death of death.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
